revised_title: Investigating the Energetic Coupling of Acid Secretion in Gastric Mucosa
tldr: The authors investigated the relationship between acid secretion and oxidative metabolism in gastric mucosa using non-destructive optical techniques. They found that high rates of acid secretion are associated with cytochrome reduction, and that changes in chloride secretion result in opposite cytochrome redox changes. The results suggest a close coupling between the respiratory chain components and hydrogen ion secretion, which may involve changes in intracellular pH rather than changes in high energy phosphate compounds.
